item.title: Need help with php
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

Use $_GET, $_POST, $_SESSION, and MySQL. Shouldn’t be too hard to figure out.

Learn HTML forms if you haven’t already.

This is my method, and it works for me:

function addPlayer($fname, $lname, $user, $pass, $age)
{
	$connection = mysql_connect(getServer(), getUser(), getPass()) or die("Could not connect to MySQL database: " . mysql_error());
	mysql_select_db("rainbow", $connection);
	$user = mysql_real_escape_string($user);
	$fname = mysql_real_escape_string($fname);
	$lname = mysql_real_escape_string($lname);
	$pass = encrypt($pass);
	$age = mysql_real_escape_string($age);
	
	$result = mysql_query("SELECT * FROM Players WHERE Username = '$user'");
	while ($row = mysql_fetch_array($result))
	{
		if ($user == $row['Username'])
		{
			die("Username is already in use.. please try again.");
		}
	}
	
	if (!mysql_query("INSERT INTO Players (FirstName, LastName,
		Username, Password, Age)
	VALUES ('" . $fname . "', '" . $lname . "', '" . $user . "', '" . $pass . "', '" . $age . "')"))
	{
		die("Failed to send data to the database.");
	}
	mysql_close($connection);
}

and this one:

function logIn($user, $pass)

	mysql_select_db("rainbow", $connection);
	$user = mysql_real_escape_string($user);
	$pass = encrypt($pass);
	
	$result = mysql_query("SELECT * FROM Players");
	while ($row = mysql_fetch_array($result))
	{
		if ($user == $row["Username"])

			if ($pass == $row["Password"])
			{
				$_SESSION["loggedIn"] = true;
